verses.kjv: And I saw when the Lamb opened one of the seals, and I heard, as it were the noise of thunder, one of the four beasts saying, Come and see.
verses.ct: I watched as the Lamb broke open the first seal, and I heard one of the 4 living creatures speak with a voice like thunder, saying, "Come and look!"

verses.kjv: And I saw, and behold a white horse: and he that sat on him had a bow; and a crown was given unto him: and he went forth conquering, and to conquer.
verses.ct: I looked, and there was a white horse. Its rider carried a bow, and a crown was given to him. He rode out as a conqueror, determined to conquer.

verses.kjv: And when he had opened the second seal, I heard the second beast say, Come and see.
verses.ct: When the Lamb broke open the second seal, I heard the second living creature say, "Come and look!"

verses.kjv: And there went out another horse that was red: and power was given to him that sat thereon to take peace from the earth, and that they should kill one another: and there was given unto him a great sword.
verses.ct: Then another horse appeared, fiery red. Its rider was granted the power to strip peace from the earth so that people would slaughter one another, and he was given a massive sword.

verses.kjv: And when he had opened the third seal, I heard the third beast say, Come and see. And I beheld, and lo a black horse; and he that sat on him had a pair of balances in his hand.
verses.ct: When the Lamb broke open the third seal, I heard the third living creature say, "Come and look!" I looked, and there was a black horse. Its rider held a set of scales in his hand.

verses.kjv: And I heard a voice in the midst of the four beasts say, A measure of wheat for a penny, and three measures of barley for a penny; and see thou hurt not the oil and the wine.
verses.ct: Then I heard what sounded like a voice from among the 4 living creatures, saying, "A quart of wheat for a day's wages, and 3 quarts of barley for a day's wages — but don't damage the olive oil or the wine."

verses.kjv: And when he had opened the fourth seal, I heard the voice of the fourth beast say, Come and see.
verses.ct: When the Lamb broke open the fourth seal, I heard the voice of the fourth living creature say, "Come and look!"

verses.kjv: And I looked, and behold a pale horse: and his name that sat on him was Death, and Hell followed with him. And power was given unto them over the fourth part of the earth, to kill with sword, and with hunger, and with death, and with the beasts of the earth.
verses.ct: I looked, and there was a pale horse. The name of its rider was Death, and Hades followed close behind him. They were given authority over a fourth of the earth, to kill by sword, by famine, by plague, and by wild animals.

verses.kjv: And when he had opened the fifth seal, I saw under the altar the souls of them that were slain for the word of God, and for the testimony which they held:
verses.ct: When the Lamb broke open the fifth seal, I saw beneath the altar the souls of those who had been killed because of God's word and because of the testimony they had maintained.

verses.kjv: And they cried with a loud voice, saying, How long, O Lord, holy and true, dost thou not judge and avenge our blood on them that dwell on the earth?
verses.ct: They called out in a loud voice, "How much longer, Lord — holy and true — will you wait before you judge and bring justice for our blood against those who live on the earth?"

verses.kjv: And white robes were given unto every one of them; and it was said unto them, that they should rest yet for a little season, until their fellowservants also and their brethren, that should be killed as they were, should be fulfilled.
verses.ct: Each of them was given a white robe, and they were told to wait patiently a little while longer, until the full number was reached of their fellow servants and their brothers and sisters who were going to be killed just as they had been.

verses.kjv: And I beheld when he had opened the sixth seal, and, lo, there was a great earthquake; and the sun became black as sackcloth of hair, and the moon became as blood;
verses.ct: I watched as the Lamb broke open the sixth seal, and suddenly there was a massive earthquake. The sun turned black like dark cloth, and the entire moon turned blood-red.

verses.kjv: And the stars of heaven fell unto the earth, even as a fig tree casteth her untimely figs, when she is shaken of a mighty wind.
verses.ct: The stars in the heavens fell to the earth, like unripe figs dropping from a tree shaken by a powerful wind.

verses.kjv: And the heaven departed as a scroll when it is rolled together; and every mountain and island were moved out of their places.
verses.ct: The heavens split apart and rolled up like a scroll, and every mountain and island was shifted from its place.

verses.kjv: And the kings of the earth, and the great men, and the rich men, and the chief captains, and the mighty men, and every bondman, and every free man, hid themselves in the dens and in the rocks of the mountains;
verses.ct: Then the kings of the earth, the powerful leaders, the wealthy, the military commanders, the strong, and every enslaved and free person — all of them hid in caves and among the mountain rocks.

verses.kjv: And said to the mountains and rocks, Fall on us, and hide us from the face of him that sitteth on the throne, and from the wrath of the Lamb:
verses.ct: They cried out to the mountains and the rocks, "Collapse on top of us! Hide us from the presence of the one who sits on the throne and from the wrath of the Lamb!"

verses.kjv: For the great day of his wrath is come; and who shall be able to stand?
verses.ct: Because the great day of their wrath has arrived, and who is able to survive it?"
